@kotp SSH has been all that I've needed up until now. Very little experience with VNC, which lead to the confusion with specifics.

So Ubuntu is likely not "Most linux installs" but yes, I agree, remote desktop is and has been very much alive for Linux and Unix systems for decades.  I personally use X and thin clients since around 1994.  VNC makes the task simpler to set up lately (as in the last 15+ plus years.  Not that X is difficult.

@kotp I know that Ubuntu and Fedora have remote desktop. I know that my desktop, which has been through several updates of Ubuntu has Remmina installed, and I don't recall having ever installed it. I assumed it to be there from an older version. I already corrected myself on the specifics.
My point was not to focus on the specific client, but rather that every Linux distro I've installed (aside from server or bare-bones installs) has one by default.
Remmina is the first I have heard of it being installed by default on most linux machines.   a 30+ year admin has, never seen it installed by default.
Screen hero is nice in that it lets you have multiple cursors so that you don't have to worry about interfering with what the other party is doing. It also has a prettier interface.
